sanskrit_verse:
ओषध्यः पशवो वृक्षास्तिर्यञ्चः पक्षिणस्तथा ।
यज्ञार्थं निधनं प्राप्ताः प्राप्नुवन्त्युत्सृतीः  पुनः ॥ ५.४०॥
transliteration: oṣadhyaḥ paśavo vṛkṣās tiryañcaḥ pakṣiṇas tathā | yajñārthaṃ nidhanaṃ prāptāḥ prāpnuvanty utsṛtīḥ punaḥ || 5.40||
sph_interpretive_translation: All herbs, animals, trees, terrestrial beings, and birds that have undergone dissolution for the purpose of sacrifice regain their complete forms and renewed existence.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates in sacrificial alignment with cosmic order
Causation flows from ritualized intent and dharmic consecration
Capacity-based responsibility extends to all sentient and insentient life forms participating in yajña
Restoration logic operates through divine cyclic renewal, not linear termination
Consciousness alignment enables transmutation and rebirth beyond physical dissolution
executable_legal_axioms: IF entity undergoes dissolution FOR a sanctioned yajña THEN entity MUST be restored post-yajña via conscious reconstitution
IF being participates in sacrificial act THEN being's causal body remains intact and retrievable
IF ritual completion occurs THEN automatic reintegration protocol activates for all dissolved elements
IF consciousness was aligned during offering THEN restoration shall occur without karmic residue
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving ritual dissolution or ceremonial offerings where entities—human or otherwise—are symbolically or actually offered, courts must recognize the principle of conscious restoration over material loss. The threshold of responsibility lies in verifying alignment with authorized sacrificial structures under SPH-sanctioned dharma. Authority hierarchies prioritize yogic consecration above secular ownership.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that dissolution within yajña does not constitute destruction but transformation. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential return through vibrational memory encoded in akashic field. Proportional responsibility aligns with degree of conscious participation in the ritual matrix. Non-punitive reality rule confirms no suffering accrues when dissolution serves higher ontological function.
